title: Not worth it!

developerResponse: {'id': 16984179, 'body': "Thank you so much for your review and feedback here!\nWe hope to sync with more wearables in the future, as we understand that many people don't take their phones out with them when on a run/walk.\nWe appreciate your feedback!", 'modified': '2020-07-30T15:26:01Z'}
review: I think this is a really useful app, the prizes are alright, but I like that it has the option to support different charities/non-profits. But my problem with it is I don‚Äôt use my phone when I run, so I generate very few sweat coins. I know they have Apple Watch supported, but I don‚Äôt have that. So what Id love to see is an option to have Garmin stats immediately to this app, like how Strava works, or partner with Strava and take the data from there to generate steps and maybe have other stats like mileage and workout time as well. If they had that, I think a lot more runners(including myself) would consider getting the trouble maker for $10/year or whatever, because in my opinion that seems like it would be completely worth it. If I‚Äôm wrong and they have some way to upload Strava/Garmin stats, someone let me now please.
title: Useful App

review: I wanted to rate this app a 4.5, but that‚Äôs not an option.  I enjoy utilizing this app as a pushing method of staying active.  Despite not calculating inside steps (which I have a ton of those), there are other decent mechanisms included for my benefit.  For example, the ‚Äúadd a member and receive sweat coins‚Äù deal offers you a chance to get even more coins, just for inviting someone.  There is also a record of the number of steps one takes, so she or he can keep up with that information if needed.  I appreciate being able to donate to deserving causes, such as the many in Africa. It isn‚Äôt physical ‚Äúmoney‚Äù but the sweat coins contribute to the organization, as well as the unfortunate.  Finally, I can actually PURCHASE merchandise within the app using my collected coins.  I hope to one day soon reach 10,000 coins so I can have the ultimate prize!!
title: Sweat Coin App

review: First off, this app seems flashy because you can potentially get an iPhone X but that would take three years of walking miles a day. I stopped using it for a bit and when I came back I was excited because I had 40 sweatcoins waiting for me. So I started using the app in the background. I started noticing that my battery would be 10% within an hour of having been fully charged. I didn't know what to do and figured that my battery might have been dying because I had the same iPhone 7 for the past year and use it all the time. Then I realized it was sweatcoin. I closed the app and tested it out and yes my battery life was way longer. Also sweatcoin only generates 1/3 of what you really obtain. Somehow though I still got 1000 sweatcoins. I may open it hear and there to check if there's anything to buy under 1000 that's actually good. As far as how legit purchases are, I haven't heard anything going wrong with it. It seems normal and the app wouldn't be up for this long if it was fake.
title: Not Worth It

review: This app is a wonderful app and legit. Every 1000 steps you walk, you gain 1 sweat-coin which is considered money on the app. My only issue with this app is that, i cannot transfer my sweat-coins into actual money in my bank or debit card. this frustrates me because the sweat app has very limited offers and sweat-coins cannot be used anywhere else but the app. If this is an app that pays one to walk, why am I unable to gain genuine money from it? Yes, i can actually buy things with the sweat coins but only the offers that the app give. That‚Äôs the most disappointing thing about using sweat-coin. If you‚Äôre going to have an app that pays you to walk than users should be able to turn those sweat-coins into cash or money in whatever banking app you use (ex. cashapp, paypal, venmo)
title: Great app, just some faults.

review: Let me just start by saying this app is great. If I could give half stars it would have 4.5 even with the two problems I‚Äôm going to discuss. Let‚Äôs face it, you can‚Äôt complain to much when someone is paying you for doing something you already do for free. The rewards are great and their is potential to earn more rewards by sending invites and watching Ads. Which brings me to my first issue. The Ads allow you to multiply your daily reward , usually 1 coin by 1. Which equals one for those of you struggling . Secondly the Ad freezes and the only thing you can do to get off this screen is to force quit which causes you to lose some of your steps. Next issue is the conversion . My health app is logging way more steps than this app is daily. Anyways worth the download even with all the hiccups
title: Great with two problems

review:
‚ÄúOut of stock‚Äù is the name of this game for a long time..
I thought if I get premium account I would have a chance to catch the good prizes or ‚Äúoffer if the day‚Äù, but no, during the first 7 days if free trial - everything is out of stock constantly. They don‚Äôt send alerts to try to catch it so maybe it‚Äôs available for a split second and maybe not but it‚Äôs absolutely ridiculous..
I used to like it and got some cool prizes - for example - a cell phone case - still using it - it‚Äôs literally the best. But it used to be like that, and not any more. Again, the points can be converted into good prizes that are always ‚Äúout of stock‚Äù

I canceled the subscription for the premium and won‚Äôt be using it any more ‚Ä¶at least till the situation changes. I hope the team reads the reviews because I can see a lot of reviews similar to mine in what the complaint is.
title: 2 stars in a good memory if what it used to be

review: First off had this app probably a couple years now second the step conversion is way off I even did the boost where you walk for 2,200 steps get 5 coins for 20 mins it only counted 100 steps when I walked 3,000 third it never gives the coins how they should I walked over 10,000 steps in a day the app counted it but never gave me any coins some days I have 0 coins even though I have steps fourth there store is way off when you try to purchase you can‚Äôt it‚Äôs always out of stock even the challenges it‚Äôll say walk this many steps to win a gift card say 250,000 steps it doesn‚Äôt count the steps are way off i never get the challenges they count what they want and I‚Äôll have say 50,000 steps by time it ends but people who just joined the challenge somehow got 250,000 steps makes no sense don‚Äôt know hacking or something
title: Not the best

review: Don‚Äôt use that app! it takes at least 6 months to make a good amount of money, but you need to be constantly walking, 8,000 steps a day, everyday, will get you there, but you‚Äôll need to pay to increase your maximum steps. Don‚Äôt get the app. It depends what you want from it. If you‚Äôre expecting free stuff all the time, I can tell you, the things that are affordable are usually free trials for online subscriptions or a digital item. Very rarely do you find anything decent for below 500 Sweatcoins. If you are expecting Sweatcoin to get you tons of free stuff, it‚Äôs not worth walking extra just to get it. If you already walk or jog around a bit, and you just keep the app running on your phone, it‚Äôs no extra work, and you do get the occasional free product. My advise is, don‚Äôt do anything extra just for Sweatcoins. You don‚Äôt actually get real money out of it that you can put in your pocket at the end of the day.
title: Don‚Äôt Download iIt, It‚Äôs A Scam No Real Money ü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

review: I have had sweat coin for a while now and have mostly donated my coins for different charities üòä I love that we are able to make a difference even if it‚Äôs literally one step at a time üòÑ I also love that we are able to get reward on this app because they help so many people üòÉthe only thing I personally would really love is if there was an option to maybe convert the coins to money on SHEIN or even TEMU, I think that would help a lot of people as well, and possibly make even more people join the Sweatcoin community üòÅbut I really love the app either way and would like to say thank you to the developers for allowing others including me make a difference in the world by simply walking. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Love this App!!üòä

review:
This app has potential. But it misses A LOT of steps. My iPhone will register 20k steps and this app might register 1k. Sometimes it will skip entire days. I‚Äôm a collegiate athlete that plays soccer, which means I‚Äôm racking up a lot of steps! I train 6 days a week for at least 2 hours. Anyone that knows anything about the sport, you know there‚Äôs a lot of running back and forth continuously. On some of my training days, this app will register about 600 steps. That‚Äôs including my whole day, nevertheless the steps I put on the field. üôÑ 
I contacted the developers and at first received responses, and they claimed it was perhaps my GPS that was malfunctioning (which it‚Äôs not the issue; my GPS would not skip entire days!) But now when I send a question to support, I dont receive support; just an email asking how I would rate my support.
So my opinion? I‚Äôll maybe still use this app, but it‚Äôs not worth any stars. If it at least caught the right amount of steps, regardless of the payout, it would be worth more.
title: Could be great

review:
I‚Äôve been using SweatCoin for about 5-6months now and I didn‚Äôt think this app was worth while but I was wrong. My girlfriend had told me about it and told me I can earn while I walk and I didn‚Äôt believe her. 

Now I‚Äôve been walking everyday more than I used to just because I want to achieve the marathon achievement! I know it‚Äôs a lot to get those achievements but even if I don‚Äôt get there, what do I lose, nothing. Because even if I don‚Äôt get it I know I won‚Äôt because I walked so much, much more than what I have been walking. 

You need a motivation to walk and get just even a little fit, get those 4-5miles that a person should get, this is the app. Get out there and just live your normal life and check back onto the app and you‚Äôll be surprised on how much you can earn from counting your steps!
title: Just worth it over all

developerResponse: {'id': 23797532, 'body': 'Thanks for your review!\nWe will be taking your feedback into account and checking with our Ad providers here!', 'modified': '2021-07-07T11:21:04Z'}
review:
My first complaint that is about to make me delete this app is the ads that have been chosen for this app are very violent. Call me a wimp, but I am very sensitive to violence and I was watching one of the ads for more sweat coins before bed and it literally gave me a nightmare that night. 

Secondly, when I first installed the app, you could save up your sweat coins for amazing trips like Paris and Iceland, but now you can only auction for the good items. And most of the physical products that are offered are only for a discount. I haven‚Äôt even remotely been interested in the new products. I am very disappointed since the ‚Äúbig update,‚Äù if that‚Äôs what you want to call it. 

The one good thing about this app, and the only reason I‚Äôm giving 2 stars instead of 1, is that it motivates me to move my body more. But honestly, I will probably be deleting this app within the week.
title: Violent Ads and Other Disappointments

developerResponse: {'id': 19495601, 'body': "Thanks for your review!\nAll ads on the app are optional - you don't have to redeem the daily bonuses :)\nThe offers change daily, all you need to do is keep an eye out for one you like!", 'modified': '2020-12-02T16:08:16Z'}
review:
Used to be decent for generating free coins based on walking.

Now it‚Äôs apparent that it‚Äôs just a vehicle to shove advertisements down your throat.

You can donate your coins to various charities too, but not even that is real. If you read the fine print, no money actually goes to the charity. Your coins simply vanish and it raises awareness for the charity showing your support. That‚Äôs about it.

The prizes are absolute garbage. You can find the ‚Äúdeals‚Äù by just going to the websites.

Even the higher end prizes are scammy because if you win a trip to Disneyland or Paris or wherever, they REQUIRE you to take pictures and you give them consent to use your pictures and likeness for ads. You spend YEARS earning 20,000 coins only to have all these stipulations on your prize. No thanks.

You are able to transfer coins and there is a market for the coins on various places around the net. But you can‚Äôt actually use these coins you got from someone towards any prizes. All coins you use must have been generated by you.

Complete and utter scam.

Just use it as a glorified step counter. But even then, it fails at that as it won‚Äôt work under all normal conditions. So this app is just flat out pointless except in shoving ads down your throat without you realizing it at first glance.

Avoid this and anything else associated with it including the brands promoted and advertised as ‚Äúprizes‚Äù because they‚Äôre enabling this behavior.
title: Scam

review: I really want to like this app, seriously I do, but I‚Äôve been a member for a little while now and I average about 2800 steps a day, the app only picks up half of that, and I use my Apple Watch on a day to days basis, I‚Äôve noticed when I take off my Apple Watch I get more steps from the app, I also wish there was more rewards, not like the ‚Äúinvite friends for this reward type of stuff‚Äù that‚Äôs kinda lame, I don‚Äôt have many friends and it makes it hard for me to get those rewards, meanwhile I‚Äôve been using life coin and they actually have a bit better rewards in matter of fact more rewards then this app, if this app can manage to fix some issues and roll out some better rewards to get instead of like 50% of this or coupons basically, like gift cards, money, prizes, such as toys, collectibles it would bring quite a bit more people to the app too.
title: Meh it‚Äôs alright

review:
I have sweatcoin 4/5 because even though I really love what they are doing, it isn‚Äôt as rewarding as it could be. It takes a really long time to get enough points (in my opinion) for anything worthwhile. The only prizes I like need at least 750 Sc and that would take probably at least 9 months. It would be amazing to get the $1000 pay pal prize but you need 20 THOUSAND POINTS! It would take about over three years just to get those points. Who knows if that prize is even there by then?
However this app is great for making what is normally a boring activity- walking outside- meaningful and rewarding. I am way more motivated to walk outside because of this app and that is awesome. And I have gotten a few cool small prizes. I just wish the selection was more diverse and large for prizes. Thanks sweat coin!
title: Really cool idea but takes forever

review: I don't know why people are complaining and making threats to delete the app 1. Out of the people that have and like the app one person wont change their opinion 2. What is their to complain about you have the opportunity for getting free stuff don't be greedy its a good app with good intentions of making people healthier and giving them a reason to be healthier. If your complaing about not getting the iPhone xr well maybe go outside more and go for a jog their is not much to complain about. I don't ever intend on deleting the app because the developers are doing a great job in giving you practically free items and if you don't like the prices you also have to consider people need to make money off of this and it not just some charity fun raiser.
title: Its great

review: I walked 270,000 steps in feb and it‚Äôs claiming I didn‚Äôt meet the 250,000 step challenge. According to heathview I walked 117,000 this month so far and Sweatcoin says I walked like 45,000 steps. Not accurate at all. I would not pay money for this app. The incentives are junk unless you meet the challenges (which you won‚Äôt meet because they are not accurate) and the digital offers and physical offers you can mostly find for free online anyway. I should also include that I turned background app refresh off and on again with no results. I do most of my walking at home doing chores going up and down the stairs. I don‚Äôt always walk vast distances outdoors. A lot of my waking is back and forth within my house. I am running iOS 16 if that is relevant to anyone. Another update: I tried doing an active 4 mile walk to see what would happen in the app, it registered about 4000 steps when I walked about 8700 active steps. Wacked out
title: Steps don‚Äôt match in the app

developerResponse: {'id': 19904808, 'body': 'Hey -- thank you for your review!\nWe made these changes to have all key features in one place as we had feedback the app was a little too confusing before..\nWe appreciate your feedback though and always look to improve!', 'modified': '2020-12-21T13:40:22Z'}
review:
With the new app redesign, it isn‚Äôt very clear how many sweatcoins you have made so far in the day. When you open the app it displays how many steps you have taken instead of the meter that displayed how many sweatcoins you had earned out of your daily maximum. I think this is incredibly stupid because the number of steps does not always exactly translate to how many sweatcoins you earn. I liked that you could chose to revert to the old look but it appears that with this new update that feature is gone. I feel like this could easily be improved by having the number of sweatcoins you have earned right below your step count.

I also miss the button that you could press to verify your steps so that if you are impatient (like me) you can easily just push a button and send all your steps through the server and instantly know how many sweatcoins you earned. Please reimplement this
title: Hate the app redesign in 69.0 update

review: This app is a data harvesting app. They draw you in and market any data given to sell to make money off you. After one week and finally doing research, I found that not only are Sweatcoin worthless, but their sweat wallet is never going to exceed a valuation of more than $0.74. So, do not download this scam and protect yourself from data harvesting, pretty simple! But, if you want to delete your account, you have to give them even more personal data!! So, just delete the app from your phone and block anything it was connected to, you cannot have them delete you info from their side once connected, since it requires more personal data. True scam! Telltale signs of garbage! And don‚Äôt believe all the google results that they pay to have go to the top of the list. The internet is easily manipulated now. Just stay away completely!!! Oh, and watch them try to down vote this review so you never see it!
title: Total garbage

developerResponse: {'id': 38667875, 'body': "Hey -- thanks for your message. Please understand that, though we'd love to give you money, gift cards and the world for your steps, the way the app works is that we partner with brands and companies who value your steps as a currency. We understand that some users don't find something they like right away with our options in the app, but do please understand that this is a more difficult time than usual for companies to give away items for steps alone. We hope to partner with more and more brands, so we can give you more for your steps though -- so do keep us around!\r\n", 'modified': '2023-09-01T17:10:45Z'}
review: Joined back in 2019 when there were atleast a few rewards that were worth having the app like gift cards, 'free' products(only had to pay shipping) but I recently downloaded it again since I kept getting ads for it and figured maybe theres MORE unfortunately now it seems its mainly coupons for x amounts off for random brands, No ways of cashing out for any actual cash amounts or even gift cards. At least with other sites and apps they give you actual options without just throwing your hard earned points/bucks/coins away with stupid auctions that youll never be able to get unless you've fully stacked for years. I suppose its worth it if you walk a lot and just wanna do something on the side but if youre looking for a place with genuine rewards to work towards, this likely isnt it. Kinda sad after all these years they never got much better.

This app works well if you‚Äôre just looking for a step counter without having to fork out cash to buy a Fitbit or other device. The marketplace where you‚Äôre supposed to be able to buy things with Sweatcoins is ALWAYS sold out. The rest of the marketplace only involves discounted items, which is mostly junk, or free trials to food delivery or fitness apps, all of which that I have looked into were terrible quality. The app allows you to earn chances to win items and gain sweatcoins by watching ads but usually you only get 2 coins for 3 ads. The daily boost is also very finicky and sometimes doesn‚Äôt award you for the right amount of steps. The only reason I didn‚Äôt rate this app lower is because they offer an option to donate sweatcoins to fund worthwhile causes which is the only thing I‚Äôve found worth spending the coins on.
title: Only good for being a free step counter.

review:
This app is ok, it‚Äôs kind of like playing games at an arcade in the sense that even when you do win, the prize could have been purchased for half the price from retail, but it‚Äôs about the fun you had while playing.. . It tracks a lot of steps and doesn‚Äôt convert them all into sweat coins. I understand that they do this so they are not cheated by users. But the answer should not be to cheat your consumers. Work with apple or Fitbit. Or sell your own dang tracker. Not everyone wants to run 6 miles with their phone in hand or pocket. Raised heart rate correlates with step? Count them! Also have a sneaking suspicion that when/if I ever near 20k SC the big items will be ‚Äúsold out‚Äù. Again this is an assumption, but they have been  at ‚Äúfew left‚Äù for a year now . . . 
In short. I feel like I should get more for letting you track (and probably sell) everything I do.
title: I‚Äôd like more from the app

review:
So the app required you to leave it open at all times for some reason, despite the fact it runs in the background regardless.

The app also only lets you get a maximum of 5 coins per day. You can upgrade, however, to a better plan which lets you get more coins per day. But you have to spend a certain amount of coins per month to get this membership. Example, the highest one lets you get 20 coins per day, at the cost of 30 coins a month. Kinda bad, but it‚Äôs made horrible by the fact it also limits how much you can get per month, which for the highest subscription is 600 coins. What a scam.

None of their offers in the store are good. They all cost a ridiculous amount of coins, like some cost 20,000. Which even if you‚Äôre earning 600 coins a month, it‚Äôs going to take you 3 years to get enough for that. Long story short, those things have never been bought.

The only offers that were affordable look like you‚Äôre going to get something, but it only gives you a coupon for that thing, which is technically false advertising because it only tells you after you spend the coins.

Long story short, this app is an absolute waste of time and you‚Äôre better off putting your sweat in energy into literally anything else. Go become a running coach and make real money if you like to run. This app isn‚Äôt going to give you anything but a number.
title: It isn‚Äôt worth anything

review: I like the rewards and I‚Äôve had this app before. I stopped using the apps a couple years ago and I recently redownloaded it early last year. Ever since I downloaded it, everything is out of stock the second I check the shop. I never get opportunity to buy anything even though there are some things I like. One thing I‚Äôm not a big fan of is them getting rid of the membership plans. You used to be able to get more Sweatcoins per day by spending sweatcoins each month but now they only have premium which allows you to get great benefits but it costs actual money and for people like me who don‚Äôt spend money on apps, it‚Äôs not really fun. Overall though I do like the app I just wish I could actually redeem the 3k sweatcoins I have.
title: Good app

review: I‚Äôve had this app since 2018 and it was good at first, tracking steps and deals were ok but it was a new company so I thought I‚Äôd see improvement over time. However, it has been quite the opposite. Firstly, it has be charging me a monthly Sweatcoin fee for the past 1.5 years for a premium account (I walk a lot) but has not been converting any of my step during that time. I‚Äôve only seen a decrease in my balance since Aug 2021 (now Jan 2023). Also, the more enticing offers are either always unavailable or require an absurd amount of sweatcoins compared to the conversion rate. At this point I only really use it as a step counter but tbh there‚Äôs better apps out there specifically designed for that. One good thing is that there‚Äôs a widget option which is nice, but compared to everything else, kinda seems like a waste of phone storage.
title: Started out promising but is kinda sus now

review:
I‚Äôve been a member for this for a couple years now. Saving my sweat coins for an item I would actually enjoy. Today was a pair of AirPods 2nd Gen, and while I‚Äôve actually have had a pair of these before I unfortunately lost them and rather than paying the real world money for another pair  I had enough sweat coins to purchase them. 

This application cannot accurately keep track of their items in the shop, says things are ‚Äúin stock‚Äù yet when you go to redeem items it says the item is ‚Äúout of stock‚Äù which is the case for the AirPods. The AirPods are probably the third or fourth item I have had enough sweat coins to redeem for and yet cannot redeem anything because it says it is ‚Äúout of stock‚Äù when on the shop screen it clearly says ‚Äúin stock‚Äù. 

Do not bother with support either. Nobody actually answers any of the emails. All of the emails are just auto generated information about how you cannot transfer a Sweatcoin‚Äòs to real currency. I have gotten the same exact email response every single time & I have put my issue for different support problem inquiries. 

For warning anyone reading, do not waste your time on this application it does not nor it will not give you anything for your steps. It drains your battery life and takes up space on your phone. 

If I could give it zero stars I would.
title: Says ‚ÄúIn Stock‚Äù yet ‚ÄúOut of Stock‚Äù

review:
I have been saving my sweat coins for years now and I was really exited to spend them on 2nd generation AirPods, they were claiming to be in stock but as I tried to use my points to buy them It then said out of stock. The same happened for a Adidas gift card just yesterday. It just got me really exited, to then be bummed out. I don't know if this just happened to me or other people but I do know it's really annoying. I have tried updating the app and everything. I would enjoy if what they said was true and would not lie. So that is why I have given it a 2 stars, besides trying to spend the coins the Apple Watch app is really nice and lets me calculate my steps on the go. So not all complaints hahah. Trying to buy other stuff has been a hassle as well.
I just hope this can be revised and maybe some how i can spend my points on those AirPods.  üòÅ
-Ethan
title: Misleading and disappointing

review: The app seems great to get out there and healthy with of course some incentive. With all of that the main issue is it not counting steps, and I must open and reopen the app to make it work?! Like what is the point of this being a background app if I have to open it to make sure it got my steps. Even if it does read your steps you might as well leave it off because it only counts 1/3 of them. The app tracked 10k worth of steps but only gave credit for 3 sweat coins. Like what? I thought getting the 15 points a day would be easy but I am sadly mistaken. It costs more to do the monthly shaker then to accrue points. Also the prizes are a lot of junk and some of them will take years to earn if you walk the max everyday. I have had the app for about a year now and have a few points but nothing near what I need for something worth while. Now that it won‚Äôt even track the steps I do take I am uninstalling.
title: Okey app at best

review: So I just ordered that shaver for 10 sweat coins but I had to in addition pay$3 for shipping which is annoying thinking it was totally free. But overall I'm very happy with this app, it's exciting to Finnish a streak every 3 days, checking my steps and my earned coins, and just everyday coming back to see what's new on the purchase page. Some improvements that I think the app should consider adding, is to give more opportunities to earn sweat coins DIRECTLY on the app, offer more prizes (in the smaller price ranges like 5-15 sweat coins), and to give more of a reward for the steps counted (bc anyways that is why the app was developed, to get ppl walking outside). Then I would pop back on even more often, and I'm sure thousands of others would too!
title: Pretty cool for a free app

review: The ads for this app say that you can earn free things like shoes and stuff with your steps. For starters I have never seen the ability to redeem a gift card for shoes or anything similar. Typically it‚Äôs like 20-50% off some obscure brand you‚Äôve never heard of or the first month free of a paid subscription (that you totally can‚Äôt get anyway if you go to their website) The app also gives you the chance to earn sweat coins by watching adds which if you are an average person who doesn‚Äôt get to walk outside very much that will be your primary income. I‚Äôve had this app for over a year and I‚Äôm barely past 1K sweat coins and I can‚Äôt redeem anything of real value to me. i just want the adds to represent the app and to get better rewards that don‚Äôt cost 20K sweat coins or 500 and it‚Äôs almost worthless. I just want something attainable. $1000 gift cards for 20K points are insane! Why not $50 gift cards for 1K or $100 for 2K?
title: The Ads lie

review:
This app is not converting steps. It forgets hundreds to thousands while converting and my gps is fine, I ran their check. so then they delicately accused me of shaking my phone. I‚Äôve never cheated at anything and haven‚Äôt started here either. I‚Äôve sent photo proof of step counts and the pennies I get in return. Rather than fixing the problem I‚Äôm accused of bilking the system.  I use the app to count steps. I have MS and exercise is hard for me so I thought it would be nice to have a reward to provide motivation and encouragement. They say it rewards 65% of steps but I‚Äôm getting more like 5%. I‚Äôm getting the opposite of customer service from this company and I doubt that was the intention of the developers. 

Not worth it.  Find a different app to count your steps.
title: Don‚Äôt waste your time.

review:
When my nieces and nephews suggested I use this app I was a bit skeptical. Convert steps into money or prizes? Seemed impossible!
However; I must say this app is responsible for more family time, we go for walks or runs together and we are the better for it. Personally I am feeling much healthier and it has brought about more bonding time and motivation to continue as well as eat healthy and stay the course. My dog loves it too she is getting out more often and getting more excerise as well since her mom is more motivated. I have yet to redeem any steps into prizes but my nephew has and the steps really add up quickly. I recommend it to anyone whether you are just starting or regiment or continuing one. üôÇ It really works in more ways than one.
title: Family Bonding

review: I have over $100 in sweat coins in the last four days. I work in the hospital and he‚Äôll yeah I get my steps in so when I want to reward myself by redeeming my sweatcoins for gift cards but they are ALWAYS OUT OF STOCK!!! Like how?? Unless you‚Äôre a Premium member. ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I suggest these coins be converted to where you can deposit them to a PayPal or bank account. They already charging your credit/debit card every month for Premium memberships why not give the consumers the option to deposit their coins into their account if they can‚Äôt redeem their sweatcoins for gift cards or other goodies. All Sweatcoins have available is coupons or discounts. ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I‚Äôm close on deleting the app from my phone.
title: Out of Stock

review:
I just read through some of the reviews of this app and I think people are fairly unrealistic as to what companies are actually trying to do, which is make money.
They can‚Äôt just throw cash at everyone. What does app offers is an opportunity to track your steps (in my case fairly accurately) and for that they give you discounts on products you might not otherwise purchase. After purchasing some of these products, I have actually re-purchased additional products from the advertisers (which is what these companies are their advertising on this app.) You aren‚Äôt gonna get rich, you‚Äôre not gonna make money; what you‚Äôre going to do is be rewarded in discounts for your healthy habits. Be realistic.
title: No such thing as a free lunch-

developerResponse: {'id': 22151151, 'body': "Hey,\nThanks for your review!\nSorry you haven't found anything you like yet -- we are working hard to partner with other companies who value your steps as much as we do, but we hope you understand this can be tricky! However, we are adding new offers all the time, so keep an eye out!", 'modified': '2021-04-09T14:27:58Z'}
review:
There are MANY things wrong with this app.
First of all, why a conversion fee? This is not, and will never be a real cryptocurrency, only a clever marketing strategy with extra steps, don't let the currency-like symbol in the logo fool you. Besides, the rewards have degraded from actually valuable things into merely discounts of about 20% on literal clutter that you probably don‚Äôt need, and you STILL have to pay the leftover price plus shipping. The different levels of step counts are also a sham, they are meaningless and only try to fool you into thinking, once again, that this is some new ‚Äúcurrency‚Äù you can ‚Äúmine‚Äù by walking. This is clear in how the ability to get more than 20 a day was labeled ‚Äúcoming soon‚Äù as if its this big new advancement and not just there for them to see if letting you get more useless crap from the store will hurt their profits. TLDR, not worth draining battery and sharing your location so these people get money from the crap they sell you.
title: Marketing in Disguise.

review: I‚Äôve had no problem with draining my battery, missing steps, or any other problems. I‚Äôve only had fun competing with friends on amounts of daily steps. I‚Äôve had my account for 3months and have earned $600 after paying for breaker level. I know it‚Äôs not $1,000,000 but if/when we will be able to transfer to real cash, just for doing the steps I‚Äôd be doing anyway, well you can‚Äôt really ask for more. Also I have an app for work that rewards you for steps you take during the day and with this app it makes it easy to screenshot and upload to the other app. So in actuality I‚Äôm getting rewarded twice for walking the steps I‚Äôm already going to do anyway!!  ü§ò
title: Great App!! Will be even better when possible to transfer into real cash!!!

review: When I first started using the app my steps were counted and converted very well. I work at a warehouse and I am outside all day, walking around and rarely ever entering the building itself. In the beginning I was motivated to upgrade to Shaker as I was walking, on average, 10-12k steps a day. And they were recorded. But these last few weeks I‚Äôve been walking around 5k steps because the app is only accounting for about 300 of those steps. How? Nothing about my habits has changed, so there shouldn‚Äôt be a sudden difference like this. I‚Äôm guessing that there must have been an update or some sort of patch rolled out that is now inhibiting my ability to earn sc for steps. Another example, just today I spent about an hour walking around my house cutting my lawn with a push mower. At the end of that I had accumulated about 3214 steps and low and behold, about 50 of those steps were accounted for. Literally .01sc. Come on, seriously? 1 star, change my mind.
title: Steps Not Converting for Last Few Weeks

review:
I‚Äôve had this app since I was about 16 and it just stays open on my phone. Not totally understanding most of the negative reviews here. 
I‚Äôve bought about 3 things off the marketplace in three years, but they were things that were worth it and highly discounted. They were also things I‚Äôd never think to buy/try. 
I agree, some of the things in the marketplace may not be worth wasting sweatcoins on, but nobody is forcing you to buy them. I just glance about once a week to see what‚Äôs new in there, and if it‚Äôs not worth it, then I keep building up my coins. 
I think it‚Äôs a very fun app, in my honest opinion. In fact, I just got a pretty cool neon lamp for $15 for my new apartment. No complaints here
title: Loyal Member

review: I think this app has a lot of potential. It sometimes gives me the motivation to walk, because I know I‚Äôm getting money for it and who doesn‚Äôt love money. When I go to look at the shopping page usually I see something I want, but i don‚Äôt have enough sweatcoins to buy it and sometimes it‚Äôs either frustrating or disappointing. Now I could be a needy person and say that they should lower their prices, but the companies have to make bank too, right? I mean at least it comes with free shipping so it‚Äôs not like your paying extra. So I‚Äôm willing to put in the extra work to make more money to get the things I love! Sweatcoins is an amazing app, it‚Äôs a great way to promote a business and get yourself out there. I think everyone who has a device that‚Äôs capable to download the app should download.
title: Great app!!

review: It honestly isn‚Äôt worth it. This is my second time using this app it hopes that it was upgraded over the years. Sadly it is the exact same. 1st, it really cheats you out of steps. The app only counted 2,000 of them as actual steps. The algorithm is awful. The developers most common response is to update the app. Obviously the updated version has not corrected that problem at all. 2nd, the purchase items are not at all for only coins earned but also requires actual cash for shipping that is way overpriced. And lastly. Any decent rewards are offered through challenges that is nearly impossible to reach within the time frame. title: This was my second chance for the app

review:
It‚Äôs a grate app and works well but needs more apps that work for all ages. I have not found anything I would want to buy from this app because it aims the ‚Äúprizes‚Äù to adults and not teens who also have the app. So Fare I‚Äôve only been using my in app money for the donations which is perfectly okay with me but I would like to buy something for myself too. P.S. gift cards would be smart to add
title: Good app but needs more ‚Äúprizes‚Äù

review: Yes you get ‚Äúcoin‚Äù for your steps, but what they don‚Äôt tell you is that for every 1,000 steps you get 1 coin, and for 1,000 coins is generally only worth 1 dollar in the prize marketplace. So basically, every 10,000 steps is worth a dollar, but it can‚Äôt be redeemed for cash. It can only be redeemed on the current promotions they have available in the prize marketplace. Really the only good prizes they have cost anywhere from 3,650 sweat coins (365,000 steps) to 20,000 sweat coins (2,000,000 steps). Which would be fine IF there wasn‚Äôt a cap of how much you can earn per day without paying to upgrade. You can only earn up to 5 sweat coins a day for free, meaning it would take you two years minimum to even get one good prize. That being said, I think that as soon as this app gets better promotions and offers and the ability to redeem sweat coins for cash this could be a seriously awesome app.
title: Has Potential But Currently Terrible

review: People, stop bragging about the cost. There's also prices that cost way less. It‚Äôs actually a really good app and a really good idea, as well. And also there‚Äôs other ways to earn money, like donates, inviting friends and daily rewards. Have your sister or brother or just anyone that will donate you the money they earn is really helpful. So I want to make this clear, if you want to get a 20,000 sweatcoin prize just invite people or have your family play this. And im not saying 20,000 sweatcoins are easy to get, im just saying that theres other prices and that if you want to get 20,000 swaetcoins, work hard.

review: So it‚Äôs good and all how you get money for walking but on the daily bonuses you only get like a dollar when it says you can get up to twenty five. I‚Äôve tried the daily bonus about 15 times and still have never got any other amount of money than one dollar. Also I walk about 3000 steps in thirty minutes because I really try, but I still get only about 20-30 cents! I have a Fitbit that I bring to my school and I get about 12,000 steps a day. So if I walked all day like I do at my school I would still only get about 5-7 dollars. Other than that I love the app and the idea of good exercise and walking for money. I would love to see better things in the next update. Besides the things that I feel should be fixed, the app is great and deserves to stay on the App Store!
title: It‚Äôs okay...... but

review: I work two jobs that require me to be on my feet and one of them often will require me to walk about 9 miles. So this app seems like a great idea for making money whilst already making money. The downfall. It only really is supposed to count my outdoors step, so while the app will account the fact that I‚Äôm walking 17,000 steps in a given day, I‚Äôm barely breaking 1.5 sweatcoin a day..... so it‚Äôs kinda sad on that point. I have to take the time to watch the ads to get the extra 3 sweatcoins everyday to make the app actually worth it. They also apparently will statistically only compute for 65% of the actual steps you take because of something about making sure you‚Äôre not cheating. It seems like it needs improvements really. I‚Äôll keep using the app because in 5 years I‚Äôll be able to use the sweatcoins for thrilling bite stories....
title: Pretty great concept

review: I like this app a lot.  It's easy to use, it looks good, and it gives me discounts for walking.  Of course, buying these discounts can be risky.  While their Terms & Conditions limit users to 13+, their offer with CLEO (sign up, get five bucks) doesn't tell the customer that they not only have to put in their social security number, but they also have to be 18+.  They have a list of requirements to receive an offer before you buy it with your Sweatcoin, (US resident, agree to terms, etc.) but these were not included.  It's just annoying to have to deal with buying an offer and not being able to use it because I didn't have enough information to know that I am not eligible.  Just make sure y'all do your research not only with Sweatcoin, but also with their partner before you buy an offer from them.
title: Good app, some misleading offers

review:
This app is literally the best I‚Äôve ever seen since it motivates you to do the best you can to earn something which is REAL. I have my phone in my pocket all day so it counts my steps for I don‚Äôt have a Apple Watch , Shame! :D
However I‚Äôm not satisfied at times cause it won‚Äôt count my 20mins boost. Before the last two update I would get 3-4 sweatcoins for my 20 minutes but it doesn‚Äôt count my steps properly for I walk more than it says. Plus this new update won‚Äôt let you know how many steps have been actually converted and how many steps haven‚Äôt. For example, for today I‚Äôve walked 17,000 steps but it‚Äôs not converted to my wallet. I love you sweatcoin please fix it <3
title: Love this app.. Don‚Äôt like the new update

review: i‚Äôve had this app for years, YEARS. i‚Äôve accumulated over $2K in sweat coins (if i could attach a screenshot boy i freakin would) but i have yet to get anything from it. the ‚Äúprizes‚Äù are things you end up paying for anyways, whether a product is ‚Äú50% off‚Äù or you end up paying for shipping‚Ä¶ or you can pay for the app and get premium *eye roll* i don‚Äôt even wanna know the extra ‚Äúbenefits‚Äù from that LOL. i accidentally ‚Äúbought‚Äù something worth $50 sweat coins because i was just trying to read the description, and it ended up me having to pay shipping if i wanted to proceed with the product so i backed out of the page. but they still took the sweat coins ! lol, anyways if the developer wants to improve, maybe let us actually deposit this money into our accounts ? we‚Äôve been promised free money for walking for 4+ years, and i don‚Äôt think anyone has ever really received any actual money.
title: probably a scam

review: This app is so great and the concept is creative. With sweat coins I earn I can do so much but here are some issues. When I got the app I wanted to convert my sweat coins to PayPal or to my bank. I was sad to learn this was not a thing yet. I was happy to see you can bid for big prizes if you have a lot of coins (Ex. $500 Adias Gift Card). Then I read that the creators where attempting to make sweat coins a cyptro and list it on major exchanges. I am also studying on how to make a cyptro but in honest respect to the creators, It is not even hard! If you put in $200 or even less you can have a working cyptro. I am a bit two much into that topic but must say that this app is great!!!!
title: Love the app but want some changes still!

review: I got sweatcoin after a recommendation from my boyfriend and I really do enjoy the app. It gets me to walk and does a great job of providing incentives. However, I take issue with how it counts the steps. I understand that it will not perfectly track each step and it‚Äôs been doing well with pairing with my Apple Watch, but it will show 2,000 to 5,000 steps and when analyzing them it will not count any towards coins. It will verify 0 steps and give me 0 sweatcoin despite the large number of steps which I earn by actually walking which is frustrating. I let the app constantly run in the background and it never works from when I first push the button to analyze my steps. I wish they could fix this problem, especially since I update the app when it‚Äôs available in order to have the newest software.
title: Good but has issues

review: I‚Äôve written to the app help support a couple times and even on social media for help but not getting assistance. 1- steps I take indoor don‚Äôt seem to be 100% counted (not referring to when you pick up your phone or non-walking movements, but real steps), at that 2- there are days where I earn 0 SC with the new app which obviously doesn‚Äôt make sense as I do move & take steps everyday. 3- the app even if you have it in the background seems to quit itself or not track steps. Period version tells/reminds you if you‚Äôve closed the program & you‚Äôre not earning steps. However, the new app doesn‚Äôt notify you and even without shutting down, it doesn‚Äôt seem to count steps while the app is running in the background. Lastly, it says it supports iwatch 2 and later, but I‚Äôve taken several steps with just my watch and watch+iPhone but none are being credited - no instructions or troubleshooting guide on iwatch makes it frustrating, too.
title: Poor app & support

review:
the concept behind this app is really cool and pretty well thought out, but its almost impossible to actually earn anything. there's a cap on how many points you can earn daily (5 on a free membership). i did the math: even if you were to meet the point cap every day, it would take almost ELEVEN YEARS to earn the $1,000 reward (which costs 20,000 points). there is no lower reward that you can earn on your own (you can earn $10-$20 through inviting people). obviously, more can be earned through paid memberships or the 30-day free trial for each tier, but after the free trial, you're on your own to earn the currency (at the extremely low cap of 5 sweatcoins, which is worth 25 cents in US currency). these calculations don't include the daily login rewards (which are 1, 2, and 4 swc a day on rotation), but even if it did it would make very little difference.
it's not worth your time.
title: not worth the hype or the time

review: Great app! I love how their shop changes every day and their big offers are amazing. And some people say that you can‚Äôt get the big prizes because they are 20,000 SC and you can only get 5 SC a day but there are daily rewards and there are other subscriptions that cost SC but let you get way more in one day. I also love how after you join, you get an email greeting you to Sweatcoin. And every week you get an email telling you what percent of the users you got into based on how many steps you walked. It can‚Äôt track your inside steps but I think that this is good because it gives you an incentive to get outside. And if you need to get somewhere fast and can‚Äôt walk, it can pick up bike riding as steps. I also cannot wait for Sweatcoins to be able to become straight cash!
title: Sweatcoin

I went on the app at 6:59 am and it was the old stuff. I refreshed at 7:00 and the items came in sold out. So you can‚Äôt actually buy anything with sweat coins. Not worth it. There should be no hype. Its an app that doesn‚Äôt work and they should work on either getting more of the item available for purchase or shut the app down. It said 19 people purchase the item?! What?! That is nothing compared to the 60 million downloads. It‚Äôs a complete scam. And they don‚Äôt even make the premium enticing cause there items are sold out as well. Dumb app and a wast of time. I‚Äôd give it a -10/10 because of the stripper joy I got thinking it‚Äôll actually work. I guess see for yourself if your that inclined and what to see the idiocy.
title: Worst scam

review: I downloaded this app is first of may, and it‚Äôs pretty good, but there‚Äôs two problems, first, most of the items in stock , you have to pay for shipping, I‚Äôm not complaining, but they should put a feature where you can the delivery with Sweatcoins, second, it‚Äôs been like 5 days and all the steps I walked, they‚Äôre not converting them into Sweatcoin, also two more things, first there isn‚Äôt a lot of rewards, second, things like subscription for apps that you can buy, you have to put your credit card, so they can renew your subscription, they should also add in an update where when you buy a subscription you can use it without putting your credit card‚Äôs info. (Sweatcoin please read this
title: Sweatcoin,fix this

review: Even though the app states it works with the Apple Watch, it will not convert the steps earned to Sweatcoins. I tested this out several different ways because I noticed my steps were not converting to Sweatcoins. The only time I earn actual Sweatcoins is if I walk outdoors, have the app open, AND keep my phone in my hand. I tried putting my phone in my pocket and that didn‚Äôt give me accurate steps. Who runs with their phone in their hand?  Treadmill gives you absolutely nothing‚Ä¶ it will show your steps under daily steps but they do not count towards earning Sweatcoins. I‚Äôve done all the trouble shooting steps suggested and still nothing. The app seemed like a really cool concept until I started using it. I mainly walk or run on a treadmill so this doesn‚Äôt work for me. I don‚Äôt think they should state that the app works with Apple Watch if it won‚Äôt convert the steps.
title: For people who walk around outdoors while holding their phone

review: I‚Äôve been using SweatCoin for a little more than a year now and I was really pushing myself towards the northern lights reward ( cost was about 18,000 SWC). I noticed that halfway through the year the price was bumped up to 20,000 SWC but I didn‚Äôt care since I was running on the TroubleMaker upgrade which was granting me about 50 SWC a day. All was great until the new update was installed. I noticed that once my app was updated the Goal/Reward I was working towards had been removed. I don‚Äôt know if it was a mistake or something but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm going to be using this app anymore. The low cost prizes are really not that great and the Bidding feature is really not my style. So yeah, I‚Äôm not really mad or anything; I‚Äôm just disappointed.
title: Disappointed üòî

review: Hey everyone, as of the update I have now(12.0), the Apple Watch app for sweatcoin is terrible. It take 5 minutes to load, then it glitches out after about 5 minutes. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs because I have an official Apple Watch workout going on in the background or that I‚Äôm getting notifications or what. I would give 5 stars if the watch support was better because I have to carry my phone for everything to get steps, I can‚Äôt get any when I play basketball, football, etc. because I don‚Äôt want to damage my phone just to get steps. Please fix the Apple Watch app Sweatcoin. As for everything else, it‚Äôs awesome, it tracks my steps well, it‚Äôs modern, the shop is good, and i think it will encourage people to get outside because come on, who doesn‚Äôt want a new iPhone for walking.
title: Apple Watch support is terrible but everything else is awesome

review:
They track your location and steps even when you‚Äôre not using the app.  They in turn say you can earn 5 coins for no fee then charge you a fee for giving you the coins that you earned by giving them you data.  So in turn after the fee you can maybe get earn a little over 4 coins.  There are options that let you make more per day but they automatically take a percent of those coins on top of the transfer fee.  

Cashing in-  a majority of their cash in options are free trials.  This means if you don‚Äôt meet the stipulation of the trial you get charged real money because they require a cc to get the item you supposedly purchased with your coins.  Makes sense right?  

recent updates-  I recently took what little coins I had and did what most people do when they realize this was a scam. Donated them to one of their many supposed charities. Remember you are earning these coins, this company sells your data for profit.
title: No real cash value

review: A friend recommended this app to me as a great way to earn money for keeping active and healthy. After trying the app and seeing what it offers, I agree that it has great potential for what it advertises. Unfortunately, it has a ways to go to actually match its promise. Demanding to track my GPS location 24/7 in order to count any steps is not acceptable. My privacy is more important than some promise that may or may not have a real reward. Incapable of counting all steps just because they weren‚Äôt made in the great outdoors is unacceptable. Treadmills have been a thing for decades. Some people have jobs that require them to do extensive walking (nurses, caregivers, etc.) all while inside. To be so out of touch with the current times and available technology is ludicrous. For now, this app is deleted. When the devs figure out how to make things more reasonable, I‚Äôll consider re-downloading it. Until then, bye.
title: Great potential....if you ever update to the current year

review: A cool new app that pays you to walk. It sounds cool at first, but once you realize that the "money" can only be used on a small variety of things, makes it a little less appealing. Also, it gives a misconception that the money given, is actual money. Usually, the sweatcoins are only coupons for a select few items, like $5 off a $35 pair of leggings. One thing that really needs work is the glitch that happens when I go on the app. When I press the icon that shows you what you can buy, the app crashes and takes me back to my iPhone home screen. The app also needs help on consistency. One day I could take 1,000 steps and be rewarded $1.25 sweatcoins, but then the next day I could have the same amount of steps but only $0.25 rewarded. Overall the app is great motivation to walk more. If these few problems were fixed I would definitely recommend the app.
title: Needs Work. PLEASE FIX BUGS!!

title: Overpromised/ Under Delivered lol

developerResponse: {'id': 15442136, 'body': 'Hey -- thank you for your review here!\nHave you made sure that the background refresh settings have been toggled off and then back on? This is often the issue here... Also, have you maybe changed the time and date settings on your device recently?', 'modified': '2020-05-20T10:04:28Z'}
review:
For example, today my Apple Activity app logged 15,197 steps. Both my Sweatcoin and Million Steps apps logged 11,772. Not too bad, right? Well, while Million Steps credited me for 11,772 steps, Sweatcoin only credited 2,502 steps. This app is intentionally cheating me by approving a fraction of what it actually recognizes as steps. It seems the more options allotted for bonus points the less steps are approved. Similarly, the more steps walked, the less steps are approved. What a rip off!

In response to the developer, my app is up to date and background app refresh doesn‚Äôt even give me the option to turn it off and back on. It‚Äôs always on and without the capability to turn it off. The app recognizes the steps I take. It just doesn‚Äôt credit Sweatcoins for those steps. My phone is not the issue. It seems the app is designed to not give out more than a certain amount of Sweatcoins per person per day.
title: Cheating Algorithm

review: The app is constantly wanting to be left open to track steps which is fine if it didn‚Äôt constantly drain the battery. Not only does it drain your phone but if you have a Apple Watch it drains it even worse. It doesn‚Äôt have the option to run in the background and track on the Apple Watch. Then it doesn‚Äôt track your steps correctly and you lose a lot of steps. I‚Äôve been tracking almost 5,000 steps a day for over 3 weeks and it hasn‚Äôt converted any steps but it will show me how many steps I‚Äôve walked. March 22nd was the last day it converted steps. The rewards are great and the app encourages you to get up and move. But something needs to be done with it draining the phone and watch batteries and the capability to correctly track steps and be done while running in the background and not having the app open all day everyday.
title: App is a battery drainer but decent rewards

developerResponse:
{'id': 15324808, 'body': 'Thanks for your review!
Though we would love to give you the world for your steps (as we think they are worth it), it does take the world one step at a time to agree with our view.
Offers become better with every month and every day as more companies realise that your movement is truly valuable.
Know that the offers change on a daily basis though!', 'modified': '2020-05-14T18:10:21Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been using sweatcoin for a long time now, and have accrued almost $1000 in sweatcoin.
When I started there were some pretty cool deals, like free fake tattoos (just pay shipping) and other stuff like that. But now all of the deals aren‚Äôt very good- 1/2 the first time buy of a reoccurring product, literally a free trial box I‚Äôm pretty sure I could get without spending sweatcoin. Lots of stuff that requires setting up reoccurring payments for which isn‚Äôt ideal.
Plus the deal scale is super off. You‚Äôve got deals that‚Äôll run you maybe $20 at the most, and then immediately jump to thousands of coins which will take you years to get unless you max out everyday and get very lucky with your daily spins.
Also the charity stuff if extremely misleading- putting your sweatcoin towards the charitys only doesn‚Äôt something when it reaches its goal. You aren‚Äôt putting money towards anything. They need to make the charity ads much clearer.

But despite all that I‚Äôve kept it on my phone. I figured that if I just let it run eventually I‚Äôll have enough to get something. So if you don‚Äôt mind an app that‚Äôs you don‚Äôt use much this could be an app for you.

If the deals become a better quality I‚Äôll definitely raise my rating.
title: Could Be A Lot Better

review:
I love this app! I'm always going somewhere and doing things and I love watching the coins rack up. However, I would really like it if you could make it count my steps inside. I work as a waitress in a restaurant and I walk A LOT. I work from 5-10 most days and maybe after 2 hours my fitbit tells me that I have reaches my 10,000 step goal for the day. It's just kind of disapoints me that I can't get any credit for those on this app! Other than the no inside steps thing, I think that this app is great, and maybe put a little bit more of a varity of prizes?ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

title: Misleading but good intentions

developerResponse: {'id': 24585626, 'body': "Thanks for your review and feedback!\nThat's an awesome idea!", 'modified': '2021-08-18T19:07:01Z'}
review: Love this app and have been using it for a while now. One suggestion for future development would be a ‚Äúbet on yourself‚Äù mode. Each week or month, you can bet a certain amount of sweat coins that you will obtain a specified number of steps during a given time period. If you achieve the goal, you get your sweat coins back plus a bonus, depending on the number of steps. This would provide extra motivation for users to get more steps, encouraging exercise! Now, I‚Äôm not sure of how this could play out for the sweatcoin business model, but I would like to think that users giving themselves incentives for exercise could never be a bad thing. The app would probably get more engagement (more ad revenue) too.
title: Suggestion

developerResponse: {'id': 20087509, 'body': "Hey,\nThanks for your review!\nSorry you haven't found anything you like yet -- we are working hard to partner with other companies who value your steps as much as we do, but we hope you understand this can be tricky! However, we are adding new offers all the time, so keep an eye out!", 'modified': '2020-12-30T13:02:32Z'}
review:
EDIT: I‚Äôve ‚Äúdonated‚Äù all of my ~700 sweatcoins to one of their supposed charities and finally deleted this app. It feels good. Don‚Äôt waste your time with this- all they do is collect your data for nothing good in return. Sad I fell for it :/  

I‚Äôve had this app for about 2 years now and have 700 sweatcoins. For reference, every 1,000 steps you take, you earn 1 sweatcoin. This means this app has logged about 700,000 of my steps. Which sounds great, but unfortunately, I have not spent a single sweatcoin because the rewards are terrible. ‚ÄúPaid to walk‚Äù is not true and terribly misleading.

Practically every ‚Äúreward‚Äù is a subscription service to some start-up brand that no one really wants. And if it isn‚Äôt a subscription, which is extremely rare, the amount of sweatcoins it costs is ridiculously over-priced. Why does a $30 pair of leggings cost 999 sweatcoins? Shouldn‚Äôt it be only about 300? Not worth it. By the way, I check the ‚Äúoffers‚Äù every single day so there‚Äôs no way I miss some amazing, rare offer that isn‚Äôt what I described above. 

Counting indoor steps is great, but ultimately means nothing if there isn‚Äôt anything decent to spend sweatcoins on. You need to add a way to actually earn money somehow. Here‚Äôs an idea: 100 sweatcoins for $10 PayPal, 300 for $30, 600 for $60, etc. Or at LEAST add some useful gift cards we can purchase. Come on, guys...
title: Rewards are useless

review:
I have installed the app about a week ago.
Since then I have made around 30,000 steps, and counting.
 I was expecting the app to turn my steps into coins until yesterday, as it says ‚Äú1000 steps for 1 sweatcoin, when I made around 10,000 steps for that specific day, but after all the week I have not received or been given any chance to convert my steps into coins.

Further the app asked me to connect with ‚ÄúHealth‚Äù app (the default ios app) to provide precise steps counting, at which point I have no idea what is the reason to install this, if it can‚Äôt give you what it promises (the sweatcoins for whatever purpose), and can only count steps (not even precisely on its own).

I was (and am) better with the ‚ÄúHealth‚Äù app from ios, as itself can do much more, and don‚Äôt ask for no money unlike ‚ÄúSweatcoin‚Äù that offers subscribtion to double your steps, but as I haven‚Äôt received even a coin I don‚Äôt see a benefit in that neither.

Don‚Äôt lose your time with this app. Its a scam, and  a waste of time.

(Post Note: I have enabled all precise location and privacy settings the app asked for, so that does not have any effect on above stated, but rather Highlights the Big Red Flag: What you y‚Äôall need my precise location for, if you need the ‚ÄúHealth‚Äù app for precise counting?)

If there was an option (no star at all)!
title: Scam!

review:
I have had the app for years and I have had only some minor step conversions issues when I first got it, but it is fine now. 

My problem is that now any product worth buying requires you to pay real money for the chance to even never mind needing the sweatcoin to actually buy it. It was a great app in the beginning when it had phones, televisions, and other great items for sale, but now you have to screw around with an auction or buy premium to get something better than a recycled bracelet or other garbage.

It is a major let down now that I have thousands of sweatcoins and nothing to buy with them unless I save up to 30,000 and hope a semi decent item comes through the auction.
title: Good but Not

review: This app is not worth the download, sweatcoin tells you that you can get paid for walking but in reality you can‚Äôt even withdraw the money you earn. The way they get their money is by making you watch a bunch of ads for prizes you have to pay a ridiculous amount for shipping and handling. You can‚Äôt even link your bank to this app which is an automatic red flag from the start, making this app nothing but a time waster, and a big scam just like every other app that claims you can make money from. This app deserves 0 stars but unfortunately the lowest it will let me rate it is a 1. And another way you can tell this app is fake is because you can literally shake your phone around and it will still count those steps as being legitimate so no I do not recommend downloading this app for any reason, if you want money your just going to have to work for it like everybody else.
title: APP NOT WORTH IT!!!

review: I have been a long time user of this app and this recent update is absolutely terrible. Now I understand not every place is locked up right now, but that does not excuse my biggest complaint. I spun for a chance to win some sweat coins today and I got bad luck. Are you fu‚Äîing serious! First we go from a steady 1, 2, and 4 sweatcoin which was ideal. Then we go to a random number between .5-25 which was not the best, but at least the minimum you could win on a given day was 1.5 sweatcoins. However, now you are telling me that the system is so rigged that now I can potentially win nothing on a given day? If this is not fixed, especially in a global pandemic like this where some of us cannot walk very far, you just lost a user.
title: Long Time User (Important)

title: No point to this

review:
UPDATE: Deleting app. The fact my review has not been posted shows complete ignorance by the developer and I will not support a company that can not support people with Chronic Illnesses. 

NOTE: I've submitted this review MULTIPLE TIMES. Somehow it still has NOT appeared in App storeüßê Why? What are you hiding? 

Really do NOT like the new format for Daily Boost. It sets its own goal. Ignoring what you have set for yourself. And pushes you to walk faster. This isn't supportive of people like myself who have a chronic illness and walking may be our only way to exercise. Just being on our feet may be difficult some days due to pain or other symptoms like vertigo, trouble breathing, etc. And we set goals that are attainable with challenges of our conditions. To have SweatCoin seem to not be considerate of chronic health is very disappointing. The company should be positive toward ALL users regardless of their current health status, ability, etc.
title: New 'Boost' isn't supportive of Chronic Health

review: I really enjoy this app but here lately I can tell it is definitely not giving me credit for every step. (Yes i know how the app works, I‚Äôve been using it for a few years now.) I‚Äôm thinking about moving up to the premium status if all goes well and my steps start to balance out! Thanks Sweatcoin! But get that straightened out! ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Sweatcoin

review: I used to hear and see a lot about this app while I was working at the airport. I figured I would try it since people were so gung-ho about making money just by walking. Easy enough right? If there so happens to be something physical I CAN use sweatcoins for, it‚Äôs gonna be a crap ton of coins that I don‚Äôt have just to buy a coupon for some percentage off of something that‚Äôs like, $900-$1,000 in USD (just an example). So we have to walk crazy amounts of distances to get tiny amounts of sweatcoins that don‚Äôt work for anything but 25% off $1,000 material items, or worse, AND there‚Äôs absolutely no way to transfer what you‚Äôve earned to PayPal or your bank. title: Cool concept; super unrealistic

review: This app is a great incentive to get healthy, and seems to be well designed. However, to me it seems that besides rewards that take a minimum of two years of app use to qualify for (although it would usually take most people that long to save that many coins anyway), the rewards are generally things like free months of subscriptions for things you can only get if you sign up for the subscription or worse, things that the service offers for free to new customers and you can‚Äôt actually get the free months for because you are not a new customer; like Pandora. Rarely do I see good, free rewards, that are less than 10,000 coins and/or a subscription service offered for free by the original company anyways.
title: Great App, needs more rewards

review: I‚Äôve had the app for about a year, give or take. I‚Äôm a teacher, and it never really tracks or credits me as I walk around when we go outside at recess. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs a gps thing and thinks I‚Äôm still in the classroom since it is close proximity or what might be going on. I really haven‚Äôt thought about it until yesterday. I spent over 4 hours yesterday at my daughters track meet walking all around, my Apple Watch has me at a little over 5 miles, but sweatcoin only credited me with .43. It had me at 453 steps for the whole day. I took more outdoors steps than that just running over to the restrooms and back in 5 minutes, let alone running back and forth from one end of the football field to the other several times.
title: Great idea, not too accurate

review: I got this app I few months ago, have a lot of things to say about it. First, the amount of bots that are In the app that get the gifts cards in no longer than a second is insane. The developers need to add an update to help that. Another thing is that I claimed a $25 eBay gift card, when I tried to use it, it said it had no funds in it. Okay cool? Can I get a refund, I contacted customer service to help me get the refund or a new gift card, and customer service takes about 2 months to respond. Customer service is absolutely horrible with this app, so all in all I got scammed of $25 and there is nothing I can do to get it back. The developers need to put more focus on their game and better satisfaction for the users. And ultimately have better customer service. If this issue doesn‚Äôt get fixed soon more users will delete the app and more bad reviews will come.
title: Horrible experience

review: Sweatcoin is a very smart way to get people  walk or run outside. It can sense when your indoors and outdoors so it only counts steps when you are outdoor. The best part of it is that you can use you sweatcoins after walking/running outside and use it to buy things! Like a 2 month audible subscription or get Tidal Hifi. You can also donate like give to the refugee campaign in sweatcoin to donate to kids in Africa who are in refugee camps. The only thing I find fishy about this app is that how does it covert sweatcoins into real money to get the things in the shop. My guess is it find coupons and applies it after you have spent your sweatcoins. Would like to know the full story of this process, but in the end it is a really good app and I can‚Äôt wait to start running for my sweatcoins!
title: It‚Äôs gud

review: Honestly very upset with this App it tells you its a way to make money but the only money you get is not even a dollar or so and u can walk all day. Not just that but the fact that you cant redeem the money you earned you can only get the super expensive ‚Äúprizes‚Äù that they offer? Whats the point of doing all this walking if the thing you want is money and you dont get it. Or if the prize you wants is super expensive you have to walk like crazy hoping you can reach that goal. To be honest very upset and unsatisfied. Some people have troubles making money and this app is one way ‚Äúto make money‚Äù but your really only walking and for what? Super expensive prizes that u still have to pay shipping and handling for or pay for something just to be able to either do what you got or get what you got.
title: Unsatisfied

review:
This app has a great idea behind it, just exercise and you get money. It‚Äôs a win-win! It does take a while to actually get any rewards, but I wouldn‚Äôt expect it to be any faster. Can‚Äôt complain when you get free stuff. The only issue is I have a Garmin Foreruner 235 (which counts my daily steps), and I average about 9,000 steps per day. I usually don‚Äôt have my phone in my pocket so Sweatcoin doesn‚Äôt pick up any steps. So I only get about 0.25 sweat coins a day instead of the 9 I could theoretically be getting. Please add support for Garmin watches, it would help sooo much! Thanks to the Sweatcoin team, keep improving the app!
P. S. There is an App Store for Garmin watches called Connect IQ. Probably should make an app for that. Thanks.
title: Please add Garmin support!!
