title: Not worthy rewarding and battery draining.

review: I mean, its an ok app I guess.  Not sure its worth keeping up with to be honest.  Theres rarely anything worthy of purchasing that would take any reasonable amount of time to get.  At least you can donate the money to various charities I suppose.  But, I mean, i work a pretty fast passed, physical job, which I would think would have me raking, but their currency only seems to drag in, and its value is so low, that It feels like their really just paying me to have access to information my phone offers and not to walk.  At that point, why not just donate my own money and buy the things I want instead of their junky sample packets that really just serve as advertisements to buy more?
title: Ehh

review:
This app does not measure up to the developers‚Äô claims, or my expectations. 

I‚Äôm with other users, agreeing that this app doesn‚Äôt recognize and record all of my outside steps. Sweatcoin‚Äôs count is grossly below my actual number of steps taken.

Secondly, as at least one other user noted, the app is draining the battery. This is even though I chose the ‚Äúbattery saver‚Äù setting.

Lastly, the ‚ÄúPRIZES‚Äù... are totally irrelevant to me. I see absolutely nothing I would seriously consider ‚Äúpurchasing‚Äù. And the prize selection DOES NOT CHANGE DAILY, as promised.  I‚Äôd rather get cold hard cash. The PayPal incentive for inviting friends, is out of the question. (I no longer use PayPal, for reasons I won‚Äôt go into here.) If Sweatcoin can pay cash for inviting others to use the app, why is it they are unable to offer a monetary reward for steps taken, as well?

It appears that I receive a lot of nothing for a lot of work (and disappointment), and a drained phone battery to boot, on my part... 

I‚Äôm uninstalling this app tomorrow, right after I send all my Sweatcoins to my son. Maybe he‚Äôll find something he wants.
title: Uninstalling tomorrow

review:
I'll start by saying that I'm not an avid walker, but I do get out and earn my steps.
I do also use the daily bonus for the additional sweatcoin boost.
When the daily offer is the Kiip reward that directs to the App Store, every time the Sweatcoin app will get stuck on a blank white screen with no way to get back to the main screen unless you force quit the app.
Of course, when you force quit, the app complains at you and tells you that have lost some steps.
This needs to be fixed. I could understand if the app randomly crashes. But it feels awkward to punish the user for a problem with the app.
title: Works, but Kiip Rewards locks app

Same thing when we go walk the track at the park. ANYTIME we start walking any significant distance/time OUTSIDE, (which I thought was the whole point!!) it shuts down! ON ITS OWN! This is not a user problem, definitely a problem with the app, but I‚Äôm wondering if it‚Äôs a glitch or set up that way! Force quit- I think they made that up!

title: Only okay

developerResponse:
{'id': 15570998, 'body': "Thank you for your review!
Sorry for any conversion issues you've run into... let's try and get things working again! 
Firstly, please go to the AppStore and make sure there isn't an update available for Sweatcoin (we're releasing new versions often with new fixes all the time!).
Next, please try going to your device settings > general > background app refresh > scroll to Sweatcoin app and ensure it‚Äôs turned ON. Even if it's on, please toggle the switch off and on again, as this sometimes does the trick!
If this doesn't work, please make sure your device isn't on ‚ÄúLow Power Mode‚Äù as it could be interfering with things. To check, please go to your iPhone settings > ‚ÄúBattery‚Äù > ‚ÄúLow Power Mode‚Äù > See whether toggle is ON or OFF. It‚Äôs okay to have Low Power Mode on, but if so, please ensure you open Sweatcoin at least once every 12 hours!
If this doesn‚Äôt work, could it be that you have changed your time & date settings recently? This can interfere with our algorithm, so please make sure to set it to automatic and then reinstall our app :)
Please let us know if these steps work!
Stay safe and Happy Sweatcoining!
", 'modified': '2020-05-26T11:14:57Z'}

review:
Soo I read some reviews of this app and wanted to see what was what for myself. 

The app uses your GPS location instead of your Apple Watch to count steps and it‚Äôs way wrong. I‚Äôm a crew supervisor for a grounds maintenance company and I‚Äôm outside all day long walking so when my watch tells me I‚Äôve walked 11 miles and taken 20,000 steps I 100%. Believe that‚Äôs true. On the same day I‚Äôm referring to this app only counted 1,258 steps üòÇ it‚Äôs a joke. You also have to pay to earn more. Let me explain. 

The first plan is free only allowing you to earn $5 sweat coins a day and $150 sweat coin a month. 

After that the plans go up in the amount you can earn daily and monthly. I thought that was cool considering everyone has different levels of physical activity in a day. You also pay for the plan using sweat coins you earn. Cool right. Well when my watch said I walked 20,000 steps and the app said 1,258 and I only got $1.19 sweat coins for it. The plan I went with is $30 sweat coins a month... until they fix the step count I will keep this review at a 1 star

review:
This is my first ever App Store review and it's not a good one.

I've used this app since it first came out and have only been able to accumulate around 2,500 coins. I have a pretty active lifestyle and have rarely spent my coins due to the sheer amount of awful products listed on the marketplace. Nowadays, the products are putrid. Most only consist of coupons and cheap products with a $10 shipping fee.

Since it's release, the price of Sweatcoin has plummeted and has little chance to get listed on the blockchain so needless to say, you aren't getting any money out of this unless paying for coupons is your thing. The hype is long gone and so are its "glory days".

Once there's a good enough offer to spend all my coins on, this app will no longer be on my phone. If it just continues to get worse, I'll have no choice but to donate them. I truly miss the days when we could cash out for literal cash but those days are long gone. Don't waste your time.

{'id': 18372131, 'body': "Thanks for your review here -- we appreciate your feedback!

title: Unhelpful

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for over a year. All the GOOD offers are almost IMMEDIATELY ‚Äúsold out‚Äù the second the item is listed for ‚Äúsale‚Äù. The ONLY thing you can actually get are subscription offers. Which require an actual purchase. 

Do not bother with paying for the Sweat Coin subscription, either. You have no better chance at getting the GOOD items. Just check out the Sweat Coin subReddit (for example) and you‚Äôll see for yourself, what everyone is experiencing. 

There are several ongoing scams. People sell their sweat coins for real money too, so people can use them to bid on auctions (and if you don‚Äôt have 30K+ sweat coins, don‚Äôt even bother with the auctions). Some people also make several accounts between themselves/friends/family to ‚Äúgift‚Äù the sweat coins to ONE account, to use to bid on the more expensive items. 

Here, I‚Äôve listed 3 scams, but there are many more. Do your research. There are better, more honest apps/reward programs out there.
title: So Many SCAMS Here

review: No response. I've been having issues with it not even acknowledging how many steps I'm actually walking. I work outside all day and 8000 of my 10 to 12,000 steps a day are outside and the app only sees 2 to 3000 of them. I have addressed this with the developers with no reply whatsoever. When you go to rate the app within the app, it immediately sends you to this troubleshooting thing that doesn't work. So if you want to get a little bit of credit for walking outside, then try this app. Otherwise, it will not convert all of your outside steps at all in the least. And customer service is no help.
title: Contacted the developers

review:
I think the principle is good but this app is severely broken. As mentioned by others, the step counting is WAY off.

First you have to make sure it‚Äôs even counting before you step out the door or your whole day will be lost. But even then you‚Äôll notice that the disparity will soon start and only grow from there. Plus no matter how much you follow the instructions to improve performance, the steps are still dropped at an alarming rate. It‚Äôs supposed to run in the background but when it goes to sleep, that will cost you steps. Plus it drains the battery like crazy even with the conserve battery turned on. 

Even the daily bonus is broke. You watch a Toon Blast add only to not have any sweatcoins added to your daily total even if you do it every day religiously. 

You better hope that you are at least a millennial or younger, and you had better learn to eat a ton of kale and other leafy greens if you plan to live long enough to collect anything good. Assuming of course that the app even exists by then.
title: Great idea, but janky af

review: This is a great app and it keeps me motivated to go for walks during the week. I‚Äôd rate it five stars if we were able to actually cash out via pay pal or direct deposit. Still love the app, would just love it better if I could actually use the money I‚Äôm earning.
title: Great app, but...

review:

I haven‚Äôt been able to get in contact with a person from Sweatcoin.

Aside from the UI, the selection of prizes is very small, even more so if you don‚Äôt have their monthly/yearly subscription.

One feature of the app is that your coins will be deleted if you don‚Äôt use the app within a certain time period! Meaning, if you end up deleting the app and forgetting about it, when you reinstall it again you‚Äôll have lost all of your coins.
In your quest to emulate a crypto currency (a currency whose transactions are stored in shared blockchain to prevent a central authority from holding all the power) you, the central authority holding all the power, decided to delete them after a while‚Ä¶ What a fantastic feature >:(

title: Its cool but...

review: I downloaded this app as an extra way to track steps and challenge myself, which it does. The algorithm used is quite different than Fitbit or pedometer apps, which is good. What causes it to get a low rating is while it calculates the steps I have gone several weeks without receiving credit for the steps. Not sure what that even means, if 10,000 steps are calculated I may be rewarded for 2,000, I can‚Äôt wrap my head around the discrepancy. Really the only way to earn rewards credit is through watching ads.

review:
Ok, so this app used to be legit, however: at this point, I have over 15k Sweatcoins, but it‚Äôs basically like, ‚ÄúWho cares?‚Äù, because it‚Äôs not like I can even use them to buy anything in their shop. 

Why you ask? Well, because every, single time I see something I might want and try to buy it, it‚Äôs either 1. ‚ÄúSold Out‚Äù (literally, immediately Sold Out, no chance to even try to purchase it), OR 2. ‚ÄúLow Stock‚Äù, which actually means ‚ÄúSold Out‚Äù as well! I swipe to purchase (it will say ‚Äúonly 6 left!‚Äù or whatever), and low & behold, I get the ‚ÄúSold Out‚Äù message again! 

I‚Äôve tried closing the app and reopening it, and again, it will tell me ‚Äúonly 6 left!‚Äù, even after it‚Äôs already said the product is sold out. 

It‚Äôs such a total scam, especially for those of us who have paid actual money for the in-app upgrades to generate more Sweatcoins each day. What is even the point, given that they can never be used to purchase any of the offers??? SCAM.

review: Sweat Coin doesn‚Äôt count all of a user‚Äôs steps in an effort to stop cheaters. Do plan on counting walking that is done too close to a building as it won‚Äôt be counted. Any exercise that is not walking is not counted. Running doesn‚Äôt usually count. Riding a bicycle doesn‚Äôt usually count. Walking in the mall or indoor track doesn‚Äôt count. CrossFit or weightlifting or yoga or ballet or ballroom dancing or carrying a 15 lb backpack through an airport ‚Äî- none of these count.

review:
I had this app a while ago, and I remember being very unimpressed with it.

I heard someone talking about it, and I thought I‚Äôd give it a try again. Maybe they‚Äôd upgraded their algorithm, I thought. 

Unfortunately, I‚Äôm disappointed again. I was excited that it would pull from my Apple Health app to verify steps, but it still must think I‚Äôm lying, even though my Garmin GPS running watch is synced to my Apple Health. 

I run anywhere between 20 and 60 miles a week, all outdoors, and all tracked on my GPS watch. Multiple days now, I‚Äôve had in the area of 10,000 to 15,000 steps, and almost none of those converted to sweatcoins. I‚Äôm not sure why it links to Apple Health if that doesn‚Äôt serve as verification. 

Maybe when they‚Äôre able to actually count my steps, I‚Äôll try again. I understand people try to game the system, but when my pace, time, and distance are all tracked by GPS, I don‚Äôt understand why they wouldn‚Äôt count.

review:
This app is a conundrum. 

On one hand, it loses your steps and doesn‚Äôt pay you as much as it says it will! Oh no! And sometimes, it drains your battery! (Just like every other app ever created, if you use them long enough.)

Well, it‚Äôs not like you‚Äôd get paid to walk at all if you didn‚Äôt have Sweatcoin, so there‚Äôs that. 

Also, the stuff you can buy-pretty cool. They say they have plans to make Sweatcoin a legitimate currency like Bitcoin, which would be freaking awesome, but I doubt they‚Äôre anywhere near that point in their development process. 

Point being, I‚Äôve earned five bucks, I think? As in actual dollars. And then there‚Äôs a free music trial that I bought and something else. Anyways, super cool app, worth a download. 

Give me a follow on Insta if you‚Äôre gonna get the app, cause I can totally get referral credit! My handle‚Äôs anxiety_pickle.

title: Merchandise

review:
The app does not accurately count steps. Too much of a difference between the phone‚Äôs counter and the app. 

This app does not actually allow you to redeem sweatcoin for a product, rather it offers a discount or coupon for your item of choice. You won‚Äôt see what the item cost is until you ‚Äúbuy‚Äù the discount and if you realize that it is not a product you actually want, there is no way to get your sweatcoin back. Offering a 50% discount on wireless earbuds is great, but misleading when you find out that those earbuds still cost $150. Show the dollar amount as well for clear selections.
title: Inconsistency

review:
Thank You SweatCo! Keep up the excellent work!

After getting over the skepticism, I downloaded this app and learned more about it while testing it out that night. 

I finally downloaded this App in hopes of finding something stimulating enough that I would use that to get out of bed and begin my day. I live with severe ADHD(-C) and after downloading this app I won‚Äôt say it‚Äôs flipped my life around but it has helped me manage my destructive behaviors into a healthier lifestyle. 

The Instant Gratification is just what I needed to motivate myself to become more productive and organized and combat my passive rationalizing. As well as helping me visualize goals, set them, and how to achieve them. 

I have consistently used this App for a month and I recommend it to anyone for any reason!

review:

title: Great app but needs work

review:
Great idea, and slick app. But, the extremely low value of a SweatCoin relative to the items in the marketplace makes nearly all interesting items too expensive to be realistically achievable. For example, it would cost 20k points for an iPhone, but a person can only earn a maximum of 600 points per month (that is, if they log 20,000 steps every day). So, the fastest possible time you could ‚Äúearn‚Äù an iPhone would be 33+ months (again, having logged 20,000 steps a day that whole time).

So, until the prices/coin value change dramatically, it just isn‚Äôt worth installing.

title: Expired offers

developerResponse: {'id': 31679963, 'body': "Hey -- thanks for your message. Please understand that, though we'd love to give you money, gift cards and the world for your steps, the way the app works is that we partner with brands and companies who value your steps as a currency. While we would love to have a partnership with PayPal, Amazon and so on, it hasn't been possible yet. We understand that some users don't find something they like right away with our options in the app, but do please understand that this is a more difficult time than usual for companies to give away items for steps alone. We hope to partner with more and more brands, so we can give you more for your steps though -- so do keep us around!", 'modified': '2022-08-26T14:16:39Z'}

 TLDR: No point in saving up sweatcoins. It‚Äôs a scam to get you to sign up for subscription services disguised as rewards.

developerResponse:
{'id': 16221062, 'body': "Thank you for your review!
Sorry for any conversion issues you've run into... let's try and get things working again! 
Firstly, please go to the AppStore and make sure there isn't an update available for Sweatcoin (we're releasing new versions often with new fixes all the time!).
Next, please try going to your device settings > general > background app refresh > scroll to Sweatcoin app and ensure it‚Äôs turned ON. Even if it's on, please toggle the switch off and on again, as this sometimes does the trick!
If this doesn't work, please make sure your device isn't on ‚ÄúLow Power Mode‚Äù as it could be interfering with things. To check, please go to your iPhone settings > ‚ÄúBattery‚Äù > ‚ÄúLow Power Mode‚Äù > See whether toggle is ON or OFF. It‚Äôs okay to have Low Power Mode on, but if so, please ensure you open Sweatcoin at least once every 12 hours!
If this doesn‚Äôt work, could it be that you have changed your time & date settings recently? This can interfere with our algorithm, so please make sure to set it to automatic and then reinstall our app :)
Please let us know if these steps work!
Stay safe and Happy Sweatcoining!
", 'modified': '2020-06-25T15:22:47Z'}

title: App is good but

review:
When I first downloaded this, I was optimistic:  an app that pays you to walk?!  Sounds great, huh?!

For a few years I‚Äôve been using this, this was my favorite app.  I even started paying by joining their ‚Äúpremium‚Äù service to earn more Sweatcoins.  So, I was earning double the amount I had without the premium service. I started to accumulate enough Sweatcoins to actually buy something worthwhile.

That‚Äôs when the problems started.  Whenever I would buy something, it was sold out. Everything.  Even the items that said, ‚ÄúLow Stock‚Äù- 100% of them were sold out when I tried to buy them.  I even tried checking the app every 30 minutes for 24 hours to see if I could buy something from this app, and no luck.  I‚Äôm sorry that I paid for the Premium service.  It seems like a scam.

There you have it:  it‚Äôs an app that pays you to walk‚Äî but you can never buy anything.

title: Wait! What?

review:
Since I‚Äôve downloaded this app, I‚Äôve received a million calls from telemarketers and never EVER have before downloading this app. 
My email is littered with fake ads and junk mail now as well as my phone.
Doesn‚Äôt truly or accurately calculate or count steps. 
Kills your battery even in power saving mode.
Goals/rewards for walking are wayyyyy too out of reach. I hike/bike every weekend for miles upon miles with highly inaccurate data and little to no ‚Äúcoins‚Äù for how far I‚Äôve hiked (usually about 12-14 miles).
Hiking gives me almost no coins, on the other hand, downhill mountain biking through technical and super rocky trails seems to give me double steps as well as driving down dirt roads with my phone rattling like crazy in a cup holder.
Have shared this app with many friends and coworkers, all who have said the same things.
Needs a lot of improvement and development before I would ever consider downloading and using again.

developerResponse: {'id': 12547611, 'body': "Hi! Sorry for any frustration caused :( Please email us at support@sweatco.in and we'll check this out for you!", 'modified': '2019-12-23T13:38:04Z'}
review:
The new indoor update advertises taking you from 60% to 90% of tracking your daily steps. 
The old version goes by gps, the new goes by steps and is connected to an other step app in your phone. 
For me, I went from earning my max or almost my daily max to earning nothing or under 1sc a day. 
GPS tracks my movement with my phone in my backpack or however I‚Äôm carrying the phone.  Now, having my phone in my pocket or back pack does not count/track on the update. 
Also, I can find a way to switch back to gps tracking only. 
This may not be a problem for everyone, but for me, my phone is never in a spot(leg) to gage motion of steps. The old version tracked nearly all my steps. The new version does not track my outdoor steps. Extremely unfortunate and where nearly all my daily steps come from. 
I‚Äôm really disappointed in the upgrade. If it actually worked, it‚Äôd be awesome. But, it doesn‚Äôt work.
title: Do not do the indoor update!

review: Great app But...... I don‚Äôt always walk outside it maybe more indoor workouts with occasional walks outside. I signed up to be a shaker for that reason, I‚Äôm being charged the 4.75 sweat coins but I am classified as a mover which is free. So am I being charged the coins but only being credited steps for a mover and not shaker? I like the app but can do without it and won‚Äôt tell anyone else about it, hopefully this is just an oversight.
title: Not cool

review:
Earn money by walking around.  Great!  I started with this app excited and motivated until I did the math and looked at the store.

I earn about 3-5 sweat coins a day. I'm not an avid mover, but let's say I made about 10 a day (a buddy of mine that is pretty active). That amounts up to about 300 per month. Which is then 3600 per year.  To purchase anything worthwhile you will drain your battery door almost 2 years to get some headphones or skydive set.  OR that could be about 7 years before you can get a new iPhone. 

That's fine if you are patient enough to wait 7 years. But the app NEEDS to be running in the background always.  It always converts half of your steps as legitimate steps. And many people I know that have opted for the higher steps plans have had issues of the app not counting even more steps. 

So, it is more frustrating to deal with.  I would rather try stepbet or something like that.
title: Great concept annoying execution

review:
I wrote a review yesterday that the sweatcoin app was messed up terribly, but the recent update seemed to have fixed my converting issue.

I walk outside a lot, but with the update on 4/1 my conversion was about 5.6% when it is usually around 75%. I updated again on 4/4 and it now seems to be back to normal. Thank you for fixing the issue!

Firstly, please go to the AppStore and make sure there isn't an update available for Sweatcoin (we're releasing new versions often with new fixes all the time!).

If this doesn't work, please make sure your device isn't on ‚ÄúLow Power Mode‚Äù as it could be interfering with things. review:
They limit how much you can make per day, they have an offer where you can purchase $1000 through PayPal with 20,000 sweat coins. If you walk the max amount and do all the things right you can only make about 500 coins per month, so it would take over 3 years to make 1000.

Also, the app only uses about 1/5‚Äì1/3 of the steps towards sweatcoins.

My health app has calculated over 6k steps and sweatcoins has accepted 2500 of them. So expect to be robbed of steps. I walk a lot throughout the day, it isn‚Äôt abnormal for me to walk 17,000 steps. But having only a tiny fraction count, is frustrating.

You don‚Äôt get paid to walk, you get free offers in exchange for walking. There needs to be better actual money, if I‚Äôm excruciating to get paid, it‚Äôs because I‚Äôm broke and need money for bills, not because I want dumb subscriptions and trial items to clutter my home.

developerResponse:
{'id': 15699674, 'body': "Thank you for your review!
Sorry for any conversion issues you've run into... let's try and get things working again! 
Firstly, please go to the AppStore and make sure there isn't an update available for Sweatcoin (we're releasing new versions often with new fixes all the time!).
Next, please try going to your device settings > general > background app refresh > scroll to Sweatcoin app and ensure it‚Äôs turned ON. Even if it's on, please toggle the switch off and on again, as this sometimes does the trick!
If this doesn't work, please make sure your device isn't on ‚ÄúLow Power Mode‚Äù as it could be interfering with things. To check, please go to your iPhone settings > ‚ÄúBattery‚Äù > ‚ÄúLow Power Mode‚Äù > See whether toggle is ON or OFF. It‚Äôs okay to have Low Power Mode on, but if so, please ensure you open Sweatcoin at least once every 12 hours!
If this doesn‚Äôt work, could it be that you have changed your time & date settings recently? This can interfere with our algorithm, so please make sure to set it to automatic and then reinstall our app :)
Please let us know if these steps work!
Stay safe and Happy Sweatcoining!
